definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: He is a very experienced general and has made great contributions in battles.
sentences.chinese: 他是名久经沙场的大将军，战功赫赫。

sentences.english: He makes himself Shogun, or "commander-in-chief for suppressing barbarians".
sentences.chinese: 他自封幕府将军“征夷大将军”。

sentences.english: He is the third general of the Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 他是当朝第三的大将军。

sentences.english: So Emperor Wudi made up his  mind, and appointed Du Yu the Grand General for Conquering the south .
sentences.chinese: 于是司马炎就下了决心，任命杜预作征南大将军。

sentences.english: ShouCheng napoleon tang wall to follow after.
sentences.chinese: 守城大将军唐壁随后跟至。

sentences.english: He suffered castration because he irritated the Emperor by defending a general.
sentences.chinese: 由于为一位大将军辩护，惹怒了皇帝，被处了官刑。

sentences.english: Kim Jong Il has also promoted his younger sister Kim Kyong Hui to the rank of general.
sentences.chinese: 金正日同时将他的妹妹金敬姬也任命为大将军衔。

definition: (old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
crown prince/heir of a noble house
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
